channel.title: Julia on My Site
channel.description: Recent content in Julia on My Site

item.title: From R to Julia
item.description: I love programming and R is a fantastic language for statisticians. It’s super flexible and great for data treatment. R has a lot of great qualities, but speed isn’t one of them, which can be a problem if you’re a Bayesians dealing with complex models. I used to call C++ inside R code to speed things up, so I could do all the initial data handling in R, and then let C++ do the real computation.
